channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Sparse Fusion Mixture-of-Experts are Domain Generalizable Learners
item.description: To this end, we propose Sparse Fusion Mixture-of-Experts (SF-MoE), which incorporates sparsity and fusion mechanisms into the MoE framework to keep the model both sparse and predictive.

item.title: Sharp-MAML: Sharpness-Aware Model-Agnostic Meta Learning
item.description: Model-agnostic meta learning (MAML) is currently one of the dominating approaches for few-shot meta-learning.

item.title: Metric Based Few-Shot Graph Classification
item.description: In this work, we tackle the problem of few-shot graph classification, showing that equipping a simple distance metric learning baseline with a state-of-the-art graph embedder allows to obtain competitive results on the task. While the simplicity of the architecture is enough to outperform more complex ones, it also allows straightforward additions.

item.title: SYNERgy between SYNaptic consolidation and Experience Replay for general continual learning
item.description: Continual learning (CL) in the brain is facilitated by a complex set of mechanisms.

item.title: Sampling-based techniques for designing school boundaries
item.description: Motivated by these recent developments, we develop a set of similar sampling techniques for designing school boundaries based on the flip proposal.

item.title: Language-Bridged Spatial-Temporal Interaction for Referring Video Object Segmentation
item.description: Referring video object segmentation aims to predict foreground labels for objects referred by natural language expressions in videos.

item.title: Unsupervised Deformable Image Registration with Absent Correspondences in Pre-operative and Post-Recurrence Brain Tumor MRI Scans
item.description: Registration of pre-operative and post-recurrence brain images is often needed to evaluate the effectiveness of brain gliomas treatment.

item.title: Mathematical model bridges disparate timescales of lifelong learning
item.description: Our model connects previously disparate timescales -- and the subdisciplines that typically study each timescale in isolation -- to offer a unified account of the timecourse of skill acquisition.

item.title: Blind Face Restoration: Benchmark Datasets and a Baseline Model
item.description: To address this problem, we first synthesize two blind face restoration benchmark datasets called EDFace-Celeb-1M (BFR128) and EDFace-Celeb-150K (BFR512).

item.title: Large Loss Matters in Weakly Supervised Multi-Label Classification
item.description: In this work, we first regard unobserved labels as negative labels, casting the WSML task into noisy multi-label classification.

item.title: Robust Deep Ensemble Method for Real-world Image Denoising
item.description: In particular, we take well-trained CBDNet, NBNet, HINet, Uformer and GMSNet into denoiser pool, and a U-Net is adopted to predict pixel-wise weighting maps to fuse these denoisers.

item.title: Neural Diffusion Processes
item.description: Gaussian processes provide an elegant framework for specifying prior and posterior distributions over functions.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning of 3D Scene Flow from Monocular Camera
item.description: Unsupervised learning of scene flow in this paper mainly consists of two parts: (i) depth estimation and camera pose estimation, and (ii) scene flow estimation based on four different loss functions.

item.title: FedHPO-B: A Benchmark Suite for Federated Hyperparameter Optimization
item.description: Due to this uniqueness, existing HPO benchmarks no longer satisfy the need to compare HPO methods in the FL setting.

item.title: Autoregressive Perturbations for Data Poisoning
item.description: Unfortunately, existing methods require knowledge of both the target architecture and the complete dataset so that a surrogate network can be trained, the parameters of which are used to generate the attack.

item.title: Dual-Distribution Discrepancy for Anomaly Detection in Chest X-Rays
item.description: During training, module A takes both known normal and unlabeled images as inputs, capturing anomalous features from unlabeled images in some way, while module B models the distribution of only known normal images.

item.title: pFL-Bench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Personalized Federated Learning
item.description: Personalized Federated Learning (pFL) has gained increasing attention in recent years due to its success in handling the statistical heterogeneity of FL clients via utilizing and deploying distinct local models.

item.title: Designing Reinforcement Learning Algorithms for Digital Interventions: Pre-implementation Guidelines
item.description: Online reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms are increasingly used to personalize digital interventions in the fields of mobile health and online education.

item.title: Controlling strokes in fast neural style transfer using content transforms
item.description: To demonstrate the real-world applicability of our approach, we present StyleTune, a mobile app for interactive editing of neural style transfers at multiple levels of control.

item.title: Stabilizing Voltage in Power Distribution Networks via Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Transformer
item.description: Utilizing MARL algorithms to coordinate multiple control units in the grid, which is able to handle rapid changes of power systems, has been widely studied in active voltage control task recently.

item.title: Generative Myocardial Motion Tracking via Latent Space Exploration with Biomechanics-informed Prior
item.description: In contrast to most existing approaches which impose explicit generic regularization such as smoothness, in this work we propose a novel method that can implicitly learn an application-specific biomechanics-informed prior and embed it into a neural network-parameterized transformation model.

item.title: Disentangled Ontology Embedding for Zero-shot Learning
item.description: In this paper, we focus on ontologies for augmenting ZSL, and propose to learn disentangled ontology embeddings guided by ontology properties to capture and utilize more fine-grained class relationships in different aspects.

item.title: Wavelet Regularization Benefits Adversarial Training
item.description: Since adversarial vulnerability can be regarded as a high-frequency phenomenon, it is essential to regulate the adversarially-trained neural network models in the frequency domain.

item.title: Proactively Reducing the Hate Intensity of Online Posts via Hate Speech Normalization
item.description: Curbing online hate speech has become the need of the hour; however, a blanket ban on such activities is infeasible for several geopolitical and cultural reasons.

item.title: Latent Boundary-guided Adversarial Training
item.description: Adversarial training is proved to be the most effective strategy that injects adversarial examples into model training to improve the robustness of DNN models to adversarial attacks.

item.title: DeepCAVE: An Interactive Analysis Tool for Automated Machine Learning
item.description: Automated Machine Learning (AutoML) is used more than ever before to support users in determining efficient hyperparameters, neural architectures, or even full machine learning pipelines.

item.title: Tutel: Adaptive Mixture-of-Experts at Scale
item.description: On effectiveness, the SwinV2-MoE model achieves superior accuracy in both pre-training and down-stream computer vision tasks such as COCO object detection than the counterpart dense model, indicating the readiness of Tutel for end-to-end real-world model training and inference.

item.title: Fast and Robust Non-Rigid Registration Using Accelerated Majorization-Minimization
item.description: In this paper, we propose a formulation for robust non-rigid registration based on a globally smooth robust norm for alignment and regularization, which can effectively handle outliers and partial overlaps.

item.title: Learning Backward Compatible Embeddings
item.description: We formalize the problem where the goal is for the embedding team to keep updating the embedding version, while the consumer teams do not have to retrain their models.

item.title: Assessing Project-Level Fine-Tuning of ML4SE Models
item.description: We evaluate three models of different complexity and compare their quality in three settings: trained on a large dataset of Java projects, further fine-tuned on the data from a particular project, and trained from scratch on this data.

item.title: Computational Doob's $h$-transforms for Online Filtering of Discretely Observed Diffusions
item.description: This paper is concerned with online filtering of discretely observed nonlinear diffusion processes.

item.title: Building Robust Ensembles via Margin Boosting
item.description: Consequently, an emerging line of work has focused on learning an ensemble of neural networks to defend against adversarial attacks.

item.title: Localizing Semantic Patches for Accelerating Image Classification
item.description: This ensures the exact mapping from a high-level spatial location to the specific input image patch.

item.title: The Devil is in the Labels: Noisy Label Correction for Robust Scene Graph Generation
item.description: Then, in Pos-NSD, we use a clustering-based algorithm to divide all positive samples into multiple sets, and treat the samples in the noisiest set as noisy positive samples.

item.title: Integrating Random Effects in Deep Neural Networks
item.description: We propose to use the mixed models framework to handle correlated data in DNNs.

item.title: Plot Writing From Pre-Trained Language Models
item.description: We propose generating story plots using off-the-shelf PLMs while maintaining the benefit of content planning to generate cohesive and contentful stories.

item.title: Combining Genetic Programming and Particle Swarm Optimization to Simplify Rugged Landscapes Exploration
item.description: The proposed algorithm, called the GP-FST-PSO Surrogate Model, achieves satisfactory results in both the search for the global optimum and the production of a visual approximation of the original benchmark function (in the 2-dimensional case).

item.title: Unsupervised Context Aware Sentence Representation Pretraining for Multi-lingual Dense Retrieval
item.description: On the multilingual sentence retrieval task Tatoeba, our model achieves new SOTA results among methods without using bilingual data.

item.title: Improving Fairness in Graph Neural Networks via Mitigating Sensitive Attribute Leakage
item.description: Motivated by our analysis, we propose Fair View Graph Neural Network (FairVGNN) to generate fair views of features by automatically identifying and masking sensitive-correlated features considering correlation variation after feature propagation.

item.title: Total Controllability Analysis Discovers Explainable Drugs for Covid-19 Therapy and Prevention
item.description: One such approach adopts structural controllability, a theory for controlling a network (the cell).

item.title: Can CNNs Be More Robust Than Transformers?
item.description: The recent success of Vision Transformers is shaking the long dominance of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) in image recognition for a decade.

item.title: How does overparametrization affect performance on minority groups?
item.description: The benefits of overparameterization for the overall performance of modern machine learning (ML) models are well known.

item.title: One Ring to Bring Them All: Towards Open-Set Recognition under Domain Shift
item.description: In experiments, we show: $\textbf{1)}$ After source training, the resulting source model can get excellent performance for $\textit{open-set single domain generalization}$ and also $\textit{open-set recognition}$ tasks; $\textbf{2)}$ After target adaptation, our method surpasses current UNDA approaches which demand source data during adaptation on several benchmarks.

item.title: An Insight into The Intricacies of Lingual Paraphrasing Pragmatic Discourse on The Purpose of Synonyms
item.description: For 250 paragraphs, our algorithm achieved a paraphrase accuracy of 94. 8%

item.title: Discrete State-Action Abstraction via the Successor Representation
item.description: Our approach is the first for automatically learning a discrete abstraction of the underlying environment.

item.title: Towards a General Purpose CNN for Long Range Dependencies in $\mathrm{N}$D
item.description: The use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) is widespread in Deep Learning due to a range of desirable model properties which result in an efficient and effective machine learning framework.

item.title: Utility of Equivariant Message Passing in Cortical Mesh Segmentation
item.description: Our evaluation shows that GNNs outperform EGNNs on aligned meshes, due to their ability to leverage the presence of a global coordinate system.

item.title: Federated Hetero-Task Learning
item.description: To investigate the heterogeneity of federated learning in real-world scenarios, we generalize the classical federated learning to federated hetero-task learning, which emphasizes the inconsistency across the participants in federated learning in terms of both data distribution and learning tasks.

item.title: Shedding a PAC-Bayesian Light on Adaptive Sliced-Wasserstein Distances
item.description: The Sliced-Wasserstein distance (SW) is a computationally efficient and theoretically grounded alternative to the Wasserstein distance.

item.title: Beyond spectral gap: The role of the topology in decentralized learning
item.description: In data-parallel optimization of machine learning models, workers collaborate to improve their estimates of the model: more accurate gradients allow them to use larger learning rates and optimize faster.
